::Shuttle/Fractyl::

The shuttle's hatch opens, ready to close again and lift off whenever.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Fractyl looks up sharply, hearing a voice and then seeing a shuttle. His vision wasn't all that great in his damaged state, though, so he couldn't make out details.

"Explain? What in the pit's there to explain?" Fractyl says in an annoyed voice, "I just got blasted by that slagging base back there, just woke up. Who in the pit are you?"



--- In nbwrpg@y..., Robin Kirkman <robin@d...> wrote: 
> ::Iss:: (Iss's thoughts)
> 
> Crap! There was another bot! How the hell did he get there?, wondered Iss. 
> Iss breifly considered possibilities. Chances were pretty slim that the robot 
> had just "woken up" from some years-long slumber, and thus been previously 
> missing on sensors. That could be the messenger of another faction.
> 
> "Vorb" sent Iss. "That bot in the clearing may be another potential ally. We 
> should investigate."
> 
> [I agree] sent back Vorb. [Let's go.]
> 
> Iss took hold over VorbIss's cooperative systems, and walked VorbIss to the 
> hatch controls. Iss found the "Open" button and pressed it.
> 
> Iss spoke throught the semi-open hatch entrance. "Robot, do you read me? I am 
> VorbIss. Who are you, and what is your faction?"
> 
> ::Vorb::
> 
> "Robot, do you read me? I am VorbIss. Who are you, and what is your faction?" 
> said Iss.
> 
> Vorb was unsure of Iss's abilit\y to operate acceptably by himself. Iss was, 
> on the surface, obviously loyal to Vorb. Closer analysis of Iss, through 
> their neural link, revealed a small issue, however: Iss was loyal to 
> protecting the body. Vorb himself, the spark, was Iss's second priority.
> 
> Vorb gently guided a nano-bot control tendril into position above Iss's 
> cognitive processors. He took aim. He pushed.
> 
> ::Iss::
> 
> Pain! Pain! Pain! Thought was wrapping itself in a body of nanoprobes and 
> Vorb was is will be Iss is gone!
> 
> What was left of Iss's mind after the inserted control tendril reeled. 
> Infinite loops were cropping up. Glitches in his software suddenly appearing. 
> And through it all, Iss's changing processors experienced everything. It 
> occured to Iss that Vorb was taking over his mind, and that he had 
> underestimated the spark. That soon Iss would cease to exist, and so would 
> Vorb, both merging to become the entity VorbIss. This did not surprise Iss, 
> though; It was like a law of nature. As taken-for-granted as gravity.
> 
> Iss shuddered, then suddenly was not Iss.
> 
> ::VorbIss::
> 
> The weird contortions of his face finally finished, what with the messy 
> business of melding Iss's mind into his, VorbIss analized his situation. He 
> had a taser, a laser, and a shuttle to hide in.
> 
> Through the open shuttle doors, he took aim at the bot which had stumbled in. 
> "Halt. I am VorbIss, poly-consolidated intelligent robot. Explain yourself."
> 
> VorbIss really really didn't want to fire. He had to act tough, of course, 
> but the energy a taser shot would cost him would be too much.
> 
> VorbIss waited for a reply form the haggard bot.
